channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Tottenham and England legend Jimmy Greaves MBE passes away aged 81
item.description: Former Tottenham and Chelsea striker Jimmy Greaves, known as one of the greatest goalscorers English football has ever produced, has passed away at the age of 81.

item.title: Andrew Neil was about to be sacked by GB News before he walked out
item.description: An internal memo from GB News channel chief executive Angelos Frangopoulos shows that its board was ready to 'terminate Andrew Neil's position' - branding it 'untenable'.

item.title: Police arrest Brooklyn man, 32, caught 'kicking woman down Brooklyn escalator after an argument'
item.description: After a week-long search NYPD arrested Bradley Hill, 32, who was caught on surveillance footage kicking a woman down the escalator of a Brooklyn subway station following an argument.

item.title: Relatives of Afghan family killed by US drone strike want compensation and resettlement in US
item.description: Zemari Ahmadi was killed in the US drone strike and his surviving family said the Americans responsible for the tragic mistake need to be taken to court. They also requested 'peace and comfort' from America.

item.title: Rio Ferdinand and Ian Wright lead tributes to England legend Jimmy Greaves who has died aged 81
item.description: Tributes have been paid to legendary Tottenham and England star Jimmy Greaves MBE who has died at the age of 81. Spurs announced the news on Sunday morning.

item.title: JEFF POWELL: Jimmy Greaves was a grand master and the most feared goalscorer around in his day
item.description: JEFF POWELL: Jimmy Greaves has died at the age of 81. One of the greatest goalscorers in English football has ever seen, sadly, slipped away in the early hours of Sunday morning.

item.title: Fury as Green MP Caroline Lucas says M25 protest was 'reasonable'
item.description: During a fiery exchange on Sky News' Trevor Phillips on Sunday programme, the MP for Brighton Pavilion defended the 'extreme' actions of eco-zealots who blocked the M25 three times last week.

item.title: Policemen douse an elderly woman with pepper spray during Melbourne's anti-lockdown protests
item.description: Shocking footage and images have emerged of an elderly female protester caught up in the violent clashes as demonstrators charged towards police officers in Melbourne.

item.title: Alok Sharma insists there is 'no immediate concern' about gas supplies amid meat shortage fears
item.description: The Cop26 president said ministers 'don't see any risks going into the winter' from a spike in global gas prices that prompted the closure of two industrial sites vital to the food and drink industry.

item.title: Stately home in Kent now luxe apartments and houses for sale
item.description: British Prime Minister William Pitt was among the 18th century guests at Wildernesse House in Sevenoaks. The house has now been transformed into a US-style retirement community.

item.title: Woman's body found in Greenwich park near community centre as man arrested on suspicion of murder
item.description: The woman's body was found near a community centre in Greenwich, south-east London on Saturday. The Metropolitan Police said officers had been called to the scene at around 5.30pm.

item.title: MATT HANCOCK: In all my time, I have never come across a group so dangerous as anti-vaxxers
item.description: UK schools closed, hospitals nearing their capacity, people stuck at home and thousands sadly dying each day. This was the shocking reality of the global Covid pandemic we faced in 2020.

item.title: Knife gangs are breaking into hospital wards to finish off their stab victims
item.description: JANE SMITH: Working in a London hospital, you get used to dealing with the after-effects of gang fights. But you don't expect to see them.

item.title: Hundreds strip off at sunrise for mass skinny dip in the North Sea
item.description: More than 800 men and women of all ages stripped down in Druridge Bay to enjoy a naked frolic in the North Sea.

item.title: Sex attacker, 23, who raped two men after meeting them on dating app Grindr is jailed for 14 years
item.description: Aaron Goodey, 23, met the men on the dating app before raping them in their homes. The court was told he forced his victims to withdraw cash while threatening them with further violence.

item.title: Shamima Begum 'told friends she'd never name fellow Brits who joined ISIS'
item.description: Shamima Begum has allegedly told her friends that she will never name other Brits who joined ISIS - despite recently claiming during an interview she wanted to help fight terrorism.

item.title: Iconic tower on former Redcar steelworks site is demolished
item.description: Images show the iconic 1950s Dorman Long Tower in Middlesbrough - a 183ft-high industrial landmark - being destroyed in a controlled explosion between midnight and 2am.

item.title: Speaker Sir Lindsay Hoyle condemns threats to Labour MP Rosie Duffield
item.description: House of Commons Speaker Sir Lindsay Hoyle has condemned threats made to a Labour MP after she was forced to pull out from her party conference amid threats from trans rights activists.

item.title: Countryfile's Julia Bradbury, 51, reveals her devastating breast cancer diagnosis
item.description: When UK TV star Julia Bradbury walked the red carpet at the National Television Awards earlier this month, she chose a silver off-the-shoulder jumpsuit cut dramatically across her chest.

item.title: Pembrokeshire hotel is slammed as it introduces £200 membership fee
item.description: The Druidstone Hotel, perched on an isolated Pembrokeshire clifftop, is a favourite for visiting holidaymakers in search of sundown drinks and selfies on the terrace.

item.title: Fraser Island will now be called K'gari, the name used by Aboriginal people meaning paradise
item.description: Famous World Heritage Area Fraser Island is set to be renamed to K'gari, the native Aboriginal people's name for the area which means 'paradise'. The Butchulla people have welcomed the change.

item.title: Prince Andrew 'is set to leave Balmoral to see pregnant Princess Beatrice in London hospital'
item.description: The Duke of York could be set to leave Balmoral to see his heavily pregnant daughter Beatrice within days after the Queen's granddaughter was apparently admitted to a London hospital on Friday.

item.title: Police seized 3,000 e-scooters from England's streets in first six months of 2021
item.description: Just 87 were seized in England in 2019, 582 last year and a whopping 3,002 in the first six months of this year.

item.title: Mother believes covid may have caused her daughter to be stillborn
item.description: WARNING: DISTRESSING CONTENT. Sharnai Crossland, 23, from Dukinfield, told Manchester Evening News she lost her daughter Nova at 33 weeks.

item.title: A Urologist debunks the viral TikTok 'Why you shouldn't pee in the shower,' and subsequent debate
item.description: TikTok users were thrown when Dr. Alicia Jeffrey-Thomas posted a video titled, 'Why you shouldn't pee in the shower. Now Dr Jay Khastgir, a Consultant Urological Surgeon clears up the confusion

item.title: Mother reveals her baby son was born with a genetic condition so rare, it doesn't have a NAME yet
item.description: Lucinda Andrews, 32, from Chatham, Kent, revealed her son Leo, six months, was born with a genetic condition that affects the protein coding TBCD gene, which doesn't actually have a name.

item.title: Thunderstorms are set to batter Britain today with 12 HOURS of downpours
item.description: Thunderstorms are set to batter Britain today, with 12 hours of downpours in eastern areas of the country from Newcastle down to Brighton and up to two inches of rainfall as the Indian summer fades.

item.title: Artipoppe: The celebrity-loved parenting buy that is flying off the shelves
item.description: A baby carrier that is popular with the likes of Emily Ratatjkowski, Jessica Alba and Gigi Hadid is proving to be the parenting buy of the year, with thousands flying off the shelves globally.

item.title: 'Freedoms need to be defended': Liz Truss slaps down France in row over Aussie sub deal
item.description: She lashed out amid an astonishing diplomatic spat triggered by the Aukus deal, that will see the US and UK supply Canberra, replacing a deal to acquire French submarines.

item.title: How did the BBC let Martin Bashir get away with it?
item.description: BBC director-general Tim Davie (left) will sit before a powerful Commons select committee on Tuesday, where he will face fierce questions about Bashir losing the clothes of a murdered schoolgirl.

item.title: MAIL ON SUNDAY COMMENT: From bias to Bashir, the BBC's closed and haughty elite must learn to listen
item.description: MAIL ON SUNDAY COMMENT: The new director general, Tim Davie, has talked encouragingly of curbing the power of the metropolitan elite. But there is little to show for it.

item.title: Now the Lancet U-turns over Covid lab leak theory
item.description: The Lancet has agreed to publish an alternative commentary which discusses the possibility that Chinese laboratory research might have played a role in the emergence of the virus.

item.title: Match Of The Day pundit Danny Murphy reveals he's tested positive for Covid
item.description: Former Premier League footballer Danny Murphy, pictured on holiday, has revealed he has contracted Covid-19, but feels he is lucky that he would be suffering worse if he had not been jabbed.

item.title: Sam Pybus' jail term sparked calls for a judicial review. His wife supports them
item.description: Sam Pybus, 32, had drunk 24 bottles of beer before strangling Sophie Moss during what was described at Teesside Crown Court earlier this month as 'consensual rough sex'.

item.title: Black Texas women filmed 'attacking NYC restaurant hostess' say they were racially profiled
item.description: Three Texas women who were seen in a video allegedly attacking a NYC restaurant hostess after their vaccination cards were questioned said they were racially profiled and called the n-word.

item.title: Laurene Powell Jobs and daughter Eve are spotted shoe shopping at Dolce & Gabanna in Rome
item.description: Steve Jobs' widow, Laurene, was spotted shopping alongside her daughter while in Rome Saturday, before stepping out for dinner after the 23-year-old finished competing at horse trails.

item.title: Diamonds used for Meghan's earrings were 'gifted from the Middle East'
item.description: Interest in the jewellery continues to overshadow the Duchess of Sussex's appearance on the cover of Time magazine earlier this week.

item.title: AOC's 'Tax the Rich' dress designer's firm ran up tax arrears of $130,000
item.description: Aurora James, 37, said the dress she designed for AOC sent a 'powerful message' but her own delinquent tax bills show she didn't take it to heart and has three open tax warrants and unpaid rent.

item.title: Covid Delta variant 'will hunt down anyone who's not had jab', scientific advisers warn No 10
item.description: No 10 has been told that 'such is the nature' of the more transmissible variant that it is 'almost inevitable' it will eventually infect anyone who has not received both jabs.

item.title: TALK OF THE TOWN: Is party queen Kate Moss back to her wild ways?
item.description: TALK OF THE TOWN: Kate Moss suddenly called a halt to her party antics three years ago following the tragic death of her pal Annabelle Neilson, from a heart attack at the age of just 49.

item.title: Dani Dyer is being stalked by Sammy Kimmence from prison after he asked a pal to keep an eye on her
item.description: The former Love Island star, 25, was spied on by the convict's friend who he asked to watch her, The Sun reports.

item.title: Tennis star Jelena Dokic, 38, hits back at body shamers after being cruelly taunted for her shape
item.description: Tennis champion Jelena Dokic has fired back at online trolls after she was taunted for her varying weights and sizes. The former World No.4 famously slimmed down to 67kg.

item.title: Hundreds of anti-vax passport protesters take to Times Square to condemn NYC's new mandates
item.description: Angered New Yorkers also protested to impeach Biden, calling him a 'killer, pervert (and) traitor' while some were spotted in Make America Great Again (MAGA) hats and sporting red white and blue clothes.

item.title: Dietitian Leanne Ward reveals EXACTLY what your poo says about your general health
item.description: A dietitian from Brisbane has lifted the lid on what your poo says about your general health, as well as the foods that will help you to become more regular.

item.title: SpaceX's first all-civilian crew return to Earth after three days in space
item.description: SpaceX 's first civilian crew has successfully returned to Earth after three days in space after the Inspiration4 crew splashed downed in the Atlantic Ocean near Florida on Saturday night.

item.title: Afghanistan's last Jew set to travel to America after fleeing over fears that ISIS-K will kill him
item.description: Zebulon Simantov, 62, had initially refused to leave Afghanistan, despite the Taliban's complete takeover, but was convinced to leave with a rescue team.

item.title: Strictly Come Dancing 2021 launch: John Whaite and Johannes Radebe are the first all-male pairing
item.description: The series kicked off amid a Covid-19 crisis after two pro dancers were reported to have refused the vaccine, sparking chaos behind the scenes as some stars were reluctant to be paired with them.

item.title: Australia to rent nuclear submarines from US as it waits for new ones to be built
item.description: Defence minister Peter Dutton confirmed Australia will consider consider leasing nuclear submarines from US in the interim while waiting for new ones to be built.

item.title: Michael Gove sees new department branded 'the Department for Levelling Up'
item.description: Michael Gove has dramatically expanded his Whitehall empire after emerging as one of the big winners in Boris Johnson's Cabinet reshuffle.

item.title: New Zealand mother accused of murder had 'the prettiest house'
item.description: Graham Dickason who found his daughters dead at home - as his wife, Lauren, 40, is accused of murdering them - planned their relocation from South Africa for two years, according to friends.

item.title: Hopes rise for new breast cancer cure as new AstraZeneca drug 'shatters expectations'
item.description: Pharmaceutical company AstraZeneca said a new drug showed a 72 per cent reduction in the risk of disease progression or death in women with HER2-positive metastatic breast cancer.

item.title: Boris Johnson is blasted over his 'casual' approach to Britain's national security
item.description: Parliament's joint committee on the national security strategy cited the fall of Afghanistan as proof that the system of dealing with risks was already 'inadequate to the task'.

item.title: JILLY COOPER's confessions of a new wife
item.description: JILLY COOPER: The flat got grimier and grimier, and the same week that a fungus began to grow under the sink I overheard someone say that we lived in 'engaging squalor'.

item.title: Bus fire shuts M1 near Nottinghamshire causing huge tailbacks set to last hours
item.description: Shocking pictures from the scene showed a raging fire ripping through the large coach at around 2pm on Saturday near to Tibshelf Services, Nottinghamshire, as emergency services darted to the scene.

item.title: TOM BOWER: Surely, as an intelligent man, Charles can see his actions bode ill for a future King
item.description: Very serious issues about aspects of his fundraising have led to the Duke of Cornwall facing a crisis, with his judgment being questioned.

item.title: GLEN OWEN: Liz Truss vows to 'reclaim Brexit'
item.description: Liz Truss, pictured arriving in Downing Street is the Tory Party's first female Foreign Secretary, wants to use her role to mould her vision of post-Brexit Britain, writes GLEN OWEN.

item.title: Starmer fails to help sports centre where he plays football
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer was condemned for 'putting politics above people' by not backing a bid to rescue the Talacre Sports Centre in his North London constituency.

item.title: Henry is a TV fantasy star with major parts in The Lord Of The Rings series
item.description: UK comedian Lenny Henry has major parts in two fantasy drama series, including the new Lord Of The Rings TV series and as Balor, a druid in the latest instalment of The Witcher series for Netflix.

item.title: SAS needs more posh officers amid influx of working-class recruits, soldiers say
item.description: The UK regiment has been led by former public schoolboys whose privileged education is said to instil the leadership skills and poise required. Pictured: General Mark Carleton-Smith.

item.title: MICHAEL COCKERELL's memoir is brimming with priceless indiscretions
item.description: MICHAEL COCKERELL: As a TV interviewee, Johnson differs from all the other politicians I have encountered on camera.

item.title: Comedian Katherine Ryan reveals how malicious claim made her fear she'd lose her daughter
item.description: In an interview with today's You magazine, the 8 Out Of 10 Cats star speaks of the chilling moment she feared her daughter Violet, then four, might be taken away from her.

item.title: Poison tests are finally being carried out on ex-landfill site
item.description: Tests are to be carried out on a former landfill site close to the home of a schoolboy who died from inhaling toxic fumes during heavy flooding in Chertsey, Surrey.

item.title: Baroness Hale reveals her 'satisfaction' from ruling Boris Johnson had acted unlawfully
item.description: The former President of the UK's Supreme Court Baroness Hale says she had no regrets and reveals that the spider brooch she wore to deliver the bombshell ruling cost just £12.

item.title: DAN HODGES: Will Brutus Michael Gove help Boris Johnson win the next Election - or knife him again?
item.description: A few days ago the Prime Minister was approached in the House of Commons by one of his party grandees. 'I wonder if you can help me with my reading of the classics,' the MP said.

item.title: Britain's most remote pub sees locals raise over £200,000 to buy it
item.description: The Old Forge Inn at Knoydart on the Highlands' west coast has seen nearby residents scramble to join a community purchase fundraiser to keep mainland Britain's most remote pub thriving.

item.title: Britain's 'white van' men face parking charges and motoring fees of £140 a day
item.description: Homeowners are footing the cost of steep parking fee rises and 'green' motoring charges that can land builders, plumbers and electricians with bills of up to £139.50 a day in one area of London.

item.title: Philip was a Hairy Bikers fan who wouldn't let any other Royal touch his barbecue, his family says
item.description: When the Duke of Edinburgh died, it was perhaps Harry who captured his grandfather's character best when he recalled him as 'the master of the barbecue and legend of banter.

item.title: Smuggler tries to sneak £4,000 worth of gold through customs disguised as false teeth
item.description: The Uzbek national had just landed in Delhi, India, on a flight from Dubai when officials caught him allegedly trying to smuggle the 95 grams of gold moulded into a giant set of dentures.

item.title: Fireworks suppliers warn of shortages and price hikes ahead of Bonfire Night
item.description: The hold-ups were blamed on factory shutdowns in China due to hot weather and public holidays to celebrate the centenary of Communism earlier this year.

item.title: SARAH VINE: The death of Boris's mum reveals how inhumane our politics has become
item.description: SARAH VINE: Charlotte Johnson Wahl passed away aged 79 at St Mary's Hospital in Paddington, London, on Monday. Her death was, we are told, 'sudden but peaceful'.

item.title: PETER HITCHENS: Holding the handrail won't kill you - but the Covid Hezbollah might!
item.description: PETER HITCHENS: How very sad that people travelling on the London Underground are tumbling down escalators in greater numbers because they are afraid to grasp the handrail.

item.title: Alas, poor Ian! Hamlet star McKellen is seen on the pavement practising lines
item.description: When concerned passers-by stopped to help the man on the street in Windsor, they were stunned to discover he was theatrical legend Sir Ian McKellen practising his lines.

item.title: ALEXANDRA SHULMAN'S NOTEBOOK: Forget the HGV crisis - where's my beautician?
item.description: ALEXANDRA SHULMAN: The shortage of HGV drivers may be threatening supply chains but equally pressing, for some of us, is the shortage of beauty therapists - certainly in London.

item.title: Dresses with horizontal stripes make you look 'significantly' slimmer than plain ones, study says
item.description: Psychologists from Amsterdam and Crete universities have discovered that dark horizontal lines are actually more slimming than other clothing designs.

item.title: Two City law firms demand staff be fully-jabbed before returning to their London offices
item.description: Two American law firms with London offices in the City - Debevoise & Plimpton and Morrison & Foerster - are demanding staff be fully-jabbed before returning to the workplace.

item.title: Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey leaves for work at 6am and exits office at 6pm
item.description: Pictures show Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey clocking 12-hour work days at the bank - leaving his home in South London shortly after 6am and returning more than 12 hours later.

item.title: Anti-vaxxer finance guru Alan Steel dies from Covid aged 74
item.description: Mr Steel launched Alan Steel Asset Management in his hometown of Linlithgow in West Lothian in 1975. He had often retweeted anti-vaccine views since the start of the pandemic.

item.title: Saudi businessman was offered help to get a knighthood in exchange for Charles charity donations
item.description: A businessman who was offered help to secure a knighthood and British citizenship for donations to Prince Charles's charities was awarded the Freedom of the City of London.

item.title: Charles and the Chinese donor who's a wanted man in Taiwan
item.description: Alongside an appeal for information, Mr Wang's face looms from what is effectively a wanted poster accusing him of money laundering and being a fugitive from justice.

item.title: 'No jab, no jive' storm rocks Strictly: Two dancers shun vaccine, another has had positive test
item.description: Strictly Come Dancing was plunged into a 'no jab, no jive' row last night as two of its dancers to be vaccinated - as the row threatened to overshadow last night's opening show.

item.title: Restaurants will be banned from keeping tips intended for staff
item.description: UK Business Secretary Kwasi Kwarteng is expected to announce plans this week to stop businesses from keeping the service charge when customers pay it on bank cards.

item.title: NHS bosses tells managers to accept their 'white fragility' over race
item.description: The report, No More Tick Boxes, was written by workforce culture consultant Roger Kline, who is based at Middlesex University for NHS East of England.

item.title: That's snowbiz, Jenna! Victoria star Coleman films Boots advert
item.description: Jenna Coleman has got her Boots sorted for Christmas, but her socks are proving rather trickier. The actress will be the face of the High Street chemist this festive season.

item.title: Rob Burrow says new wonder drug has given him fresh hope of seeing his three young children grow up
item.description: The former Leeds Rhinos, England and Great Britain star, 38, married to teenage sweetheart Lindsey, is desperate to help raise Macy, nine, Maya, six, and Jackson, two.

item.title: Boris Johnson will fly to the US TODAY to warn Joe Biden on climate deal
item.description: The Prime Minister will host a meeting on climate change at the United Nations tomorrow and address the UN General Assembly in the US.

item.title: Visitors enjoy spectacular displays at Duxford's 1940-themed Battle of Britain air show 2021
item.description: Visitors immersed themselves in a day of 1940's-themed action during a spectacular display of historic planes at an RAF site that served a key role in Britain's finest hour - The Battle of Britain.

item.title: Sir Elton John requests urgent meeting with new Culture Secretary Nadine Dorries over visa rules
item.description: The singer is lobbying for the relaxation of rules which do not guarantee visa-free travel for musicians in the EU.

item.title: BBC hit by new Martin Bashir shame
item.description: Bashir, who tricked Princess Diana into the interview that made his name, got the clothing from the grieving mother of nine-year-old Babes In The Wood murder victim Karen Hadaway.

item.title: Royal College of Nursing secretly paid former boss a £135,000 payoff over links to Charles' donor
item.description: The Mail on Sunday can reveal that Dame Donna Kinnair faced an investigation over claims that she had accepted hospitality from financier George Farha while on holiday in Morocco.

item.title: DOROTHY BYRNE: Failures reveal BBC's utter contempt for a grieving mum and police
item.description: DOROTHY BYRNE: The mother of a murdered child has been grievously wronged and yet again the reputation of BBC journalism is undermined.

item.title: NHS's diversity tsar is paid £35,000 more than its chief executive
item.description: According to accounts for 2019-20, Prerana Issar joined NHS England as Chief People Officer in April 2019 on a salary of between £230,000 and £235,000 - equivalent to nine nurses.

item.title: TALK OF THE TOWN: Middletons snub uncle Gary Goldsmith over lavish wedding
item.description: TALK OF THE TOWN: Gary Goldsmith, 56, was not invited to the wedding of his nephew James Middleton to his wife Alizee Thevenet in the South of France last weekend.

item.title: TALK OF THE TOWN: Stella McCartney's £1,500 shock for pals
item.description: TALK OF THE TOWN: Stella McCartney invited some of her closest friends to Cliveden House in Berkshire for her 50th birthday party last weekend.

item.title: TALK OF THE TOWN: Influencer Millie Mackintosh is running out of 'twinning' outfits
item.description: TALK OF THE TOWN: Expectant mum Millie Mackintosh has finally run out of 'twinning' outfits for her and daughter Sienna to wear for social media.

item.title: Their apocalyptic warnings have proved inaccurate, but 'experts' still have the Government's ear
item.description: From the first appearance of the virus, this UK government advisory body has been accused of over-egging its predictions in order to frighten Ministers into taking drastic action.

item.title: 'I never ever dreamt I would have kids': EastEnders star Sid Owen to become a dad at 49-years-old
item.description: The actor, who is known for playing Ricky Butcher on the soap, revealed he is marrying and expecting a baby with 42-year-old waitress Victoria Shores.

item.title: Biden's warning to China: USS Wyoming test launches Trident II nuclear missiles off Cape Canaveral
item.description: The US Navy successfully conducted a scheduled two-missile test launch of un-armed life-extended Trident D5LE nuclear missiles from the USS Wyoming on Friday off Cape Canaveral.

item.title: Anti-lockdown demonstrators overpower cops in Melbourne as Freedom rally turns violent
item.description: While anti-lockdown protests around Australia failed again on Saturday, Melbourne hooligans were determined to win one confrontation with police, so around 100 smashed through police lines.

item.title: Not kitten around! Moment brave stands up to coyote and chases it away after tense stand-off
item.description: Video captures shocking animal confrontation as cat quickly chases coyote away immediately proving whose in-furior.

item.title: Boxer Amir Khan claims claims he was escorted off US flight for 'no reason'
item.description: The 34-year-old, who has also appeared on reality television shows including I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here!, claimed he had been 'banned' by American Airlines.

item.title: Humble inhaler that causes global warming: Drugs giant reveals the devices are biggest emissions
item.description: The British pharmaceutical giant said an astonishing 45 per cent of its overall emissions could be traced to asthma inhalers and it has begun trials of a less polluting replacement.

item.title: Should healthy Britons be given blood pressure tablets?
item.description: Jill Stevenson, 55, from Ayreshire, pictured, is one of the one in four Britons who has high blood pressure and takes daily pills to reduce the risk of a heart attack or stroke.

item.title: HEALTH NOTES: Avocados trim hidden body fat
item.description: Richard Mackenzie, a professor of life sciences at the University of Roehampton in London said avocados can slow down the digestive process and inhibit the desire to have snacks.

item.title: CIA issued warning that children were at scene of Kabul drone strike BEFORE missile hit car
item.description: Three sources said the urgent warning came just moments too late - after the military launched the Hellfire missile and just seconds before it struck.

item.title: Can you be friends with an anti-vaxxer?
item.description: Nilufer Atik, left, has had two doses of the AstraZeneca vaccine, but was afraid to tell her friend Sarah, right, because she believes that eating healthily and exercising will protect her.

item.title: Two tablet a day treatment that can stop bladder cancer for 18 months
item.description: Professor Thomas Powels, pictured, oncologist and director of the Barts Cancer Centre where the trial took place said those given the two-pronged treatment will 'undoubtedly live for longer'.

item.title: DR ELLIE CANNON: I'm 78 and suffering... why won't my GP let me go back on HRT?
item.description: DR ELLIE CANNON: Today, a 78-year-old woman has asked our resident GP why her own family doctor will not allow her to take HRT again despite the potential benefits of the treatment.

item.title: The best last-minute holiday deals, from Croatia to the Caribbean
item.description: Every week our Holiday Hero Neil Simpson takes an in-depth look at a holiday topic, doing all the legwork so you don't have to. This week: Last-minute holidays.

item.title: Holidays in Switzerland: The joys of Zurich's riverside
item.description: The ace up Zurich's sleeve is its badis, or lake-side open-air swimming pools, some of which are more like nightclubs, featuring bars and DJs. Will Hide dives in...

item.title: Autumn activities: Discover the stunning colours on display in British arboretums
item.description: In spite of their beauty and history, arboretums are often overlooked as places to visit, but in the autumn months there is nowhere better to appreciate the diversity of trees and their richly coloured foliage.

item.title: Ministers were urged to withhold vaccine trial data from the EU in row over travel restrictions
item.description: Almost 20,000 Brits have been effectively banned from travelling to Europe for work, holidays or to see friends and family as they took part in trials for Novavax and Valneva jabs

item.title: British woman who escaped Malaysia death penalty returns to the UK with 'ring on her wedding finger'
item.description: Samantha Jones, 55, was freed after spending three years in a rat-infested cell in Pokok Sena, Malaysia, and pictured back home at her three-bedroom home near Yeovil wearing a 'ring on her wedding finger'.

item.title: Amateur photographers share VERY funny snaps of animals not looking their best
item.description: The animal kingdom inspires many amateur wildlife photographers to pick up their cameras - but these images prove that some of them don't quite have the natural talent.

item.title: Heartwarming photos of older couples prove that age is no barrier to romance
item.description: Shareably has rounded up a selection of viral photos from around the world that show older couples in love - including a husband in the U.S, doing his wife's hair after she had surgery on her wrist.

item.title: Dating expert reveals the mistakes that YOU could me making on a first date
item.description: UK-based dating expert, Kate Taylor, has looked at new survey data from Ourtime to investigate what mistakes singles are making on a first date that could be costing them their chance at love.

item.title: Birmingham hotel review: Inside High Field Town House in Edgbaston
item.description: The Inspector checked into High Field Town House in Edgbaston. He liked his 'bright and cheerful' bedroom. But he was underwhelmed with his burger at dinner, as well as the breakfast offering.

item.title: Los Angeles is hit by magnitude 4.3 earthquake - the second tremor to rock city in a week
item.description: The magnitude-4.3 quake struck shortly after 7:58 p.m. and was centered near Carson, about 21 miles (34 kilometers) southeast of downtown LA.
